A simple calorimeter just consists of a thermometer attached to a metal container full of water suspended above a combustion chamber.  It i...

links.description: Mobile phone tracking is a process for identifying the location of a mobile phone, whether stationary or moving. links.title: Haversine formula - Wikipedia
links.description: The haversine formula determines the great-circle distance between two points on a sphere given their longitudes and latitudes. Important in navigation, it is a special case of a more general formula  in spherical trigonometry, the law of haversines, that relates the sides and angles of spherical triangles.
links.original_title: Haversine Formula

links.title: Vincenty's formulae - Wikipedia
links.description: Vincenty's formulae are two related iterative methods used in geodesy to calculate the distance between two points on the surface of a spheroid, developed by Thaddeus Vincenty (1975a). They are based on the assumption that the figure of the Earth is an oblate spheroid, and hence are more accurate than methods that assume a spherical Earth, such as great-circle distance.

links.title: 1916 Zoning Resolution - Wikipedia
links.description: The 1916 Zoning Resolution in New York City  was the first citywide zoning code in the United States.
